Machining Guide

To accomplish this section you should have appropriate machining skills.

You can outsource the parts by sending this section to your preffered machining techinician or company.

For this section you will need:

Tools

  • 1 150mm mini hacksaw
  • 1 M3 tap set
  • 1 tap wrench

Machine

  • 1 3d printer
  • 1 Laser cutter

Material

  • 1 clear plastic sheet
  • 1 maker beam XL
  • 500 g of PLA filament

Step 1: Printing parts

Support from bed plate is required. It's unnecesary to add support everywhere. Add a brim to ensure the small parts are anchored appropriately.

  • Use a 3d printer and PLA filament to print the following parts:
    • Latch handle
    • Latch base
    • Electronics top
    • Corner
    • Feeding wall
    • Led series wall
    • Curved wall
    • Tunnel connector
    • Tunnel clamp
    • Hinge
    • Trap latch
    • Groove pins

Step 2: Laser cut parts

  • Use a Laser cutter and clear plastic sheet to produce the following:
    • 1 pc of Ecase_Back
    • 1 pc of Ecase_Base
    • 1 pc of Ecase_Front
    • 2 pcs of Ecase_R&L
    • 1 pc of platform support
    • 2 pcs of Platform base
    • 1 pc of side entry wall
    • 1 pc of side plain wall
    • 1 pc of case back,
    • 1 pc of case base
    • 1 pc of case front
    • 1 pc of case right
    • 1 pc of case left

Step 3: Cut and thread beams

  • Using 150mm mini hacksaw cut 2 pcs 200mm long and 6 pcs 150mm long from the maker beam XL

  • From the M3 tap set place the taping screw on the tap wrench then make threads on the holes at the end of the maker beam xl pieces.
